newsitem.title: GERMANY: Puma shares yo-yo after 96 figures.
newsitem.headline: Puma shares yo-yo after 96 figures.

text.p: Shares in German sportswear maker Puma AG yo-yoed over the course of share trade on Friday after the group announced group operating profits of 65.2 million marks ($38.7 million), up from 60.6 million marks in 1995.
Puma shares were 2.20 marks, or 3.49 percent, lower at 60.80 marks in mid-session bourse trade. However, in pre-bourse trade the shares had risen around eight percent to 67 marks.
The overall DAX index was down 12.52 points, or 0.39 percent, at 3,183.51 points.
Group net profit in the period was 83.8 million marks up from 48.2 million, but this figure included an extraordinary gain of 24.1 million marks.
"The figures came in below our expectations because of the extraordinary gain. Before the figures everyone's expectations were very high," said a Frankfurt share trader.
